_header: Shall I that wrought all thing of nought
_description: Song by James Ryman, 8 cross-rhymed quatrains with first serving as a burden to be repeated after each of the other seven stanzas

CULEe112.First Lines:
Shalle I that wrought althing of noughtDere moder shalle I
                    sooShal I for man that I have wroughtTake dethe withe payne and
                    wooMyne owne dere sonne and paramourWherefore shuldest thou do
                    soo…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…To me in peyne yet come ageyneAnd bringe me oute of
                    woo
CULEe112.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius,
                        ed.  
             “Die Gedichte des Franziskaners Jacob Ryman.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         89 (1892): 167-338: 235-6.
